item.title: Demon Slayer -Kimetsu no Yaiba- The Hinokami Chronicles 2 announces Western release date
item.content:encoded:
https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/03/01/demon-slayer-kimetsu-no-yaiba-the-hinokami-chronicles-2-announces-western-release-date/

While it might be the weekend, news waits for no one, and this Saturday the latest out of Sega is that arena fighter Demon Slayer -Kimetsu no Yaiba- The Hinokami Chronicles 2 is all set to release this summer on the 5th of August, 2025. As part of the announcement, they also dropped a brand new trailer, showcasing how the District Art Area is depicted in the game.

This looks like another great digital version of the animated show, and for fans it’ll have been a long wait since the original game’s release in 2021. Sega also dropped a whole host of information about the different versions of the game, so you can start to plan ahead just what flavour of edition you might want.

Digital pre-orders start Monday, March 3 for PlayStation, Xbox, and Steam platforms, with the Nintendo Switch version to follow later.

Digital Deluxe Edition (£64.99 MSRP)

Those who order the Digital Deluxe Edition will unlock the following:

Base game
2 Kimetsu Academy Character Unlock Keys – Kyojuro Rengoku and Tengen Uzui
4 Character Unlock Keys – Tengen Uzui, Obanai Iguro, Sanemi Shinazugawa, and Gyomei Himejima
VS Mode System Voice: Upper Rank Demons Set – Akaza, Daki, Gyutaro, Gyokko, and Zohakuten
3 Battle Attire Costumes – Tanjiro Kamado’s Kimono (Entertainment District), Inosuke Hashibira’s Kimono (Entertainment District), and Tengen Uzui’s Shinobi Attire
Pre-order bonuses: Advanced Access* – The ability to play the game starting on July 31, 2025, and 2 Character Unlock Keys** – Muichiro Tokito and Mitsuri Kanroji
Digital Standard Edition (£54.99 MSRP)

The Digital Standard Edition features the following:

Base game
2 Kimetsu Academy Character Unlock Keys – Kyojuro Rengoku and Tengen Uzui
Pre-order bonus: 2 Character Unlock Keys** – Muichiro Tokito and Mitsuri Kanroji
Physical Edition (£54.99 MSRP)
​​
​A physical edition for The Hinokami Chronicles 2 will also be available to pre-order. This version includes:

Base Game
2 Character Unlock Keys*** – Muichiro Tokito and Mitsuri Kanroji
*Must pre-order the Digital Deluxe Edition prior to August 5, 2025. Not available for Nintendo Switch.
​**Only available until the game launches on August 5, 2025.
​***Only available in the limited time launch version of the physical edition.

Bonuses for Linking Save Data

Finally, the following bonus items will be available for those with save data from either Demon Slayer -Kimetsu no Yaiba- The Hinokami Chronicles or Demon Slayer -Kimetsu no Yaiba- Sweep the Board!.

Bonuses for The Hinokami Chronicles save data:
6 Kimetsu Academy Character Unlock Keys – Tanjiro Kamado, Nezuko Kamado, Zenitsu Agatsuma, Inosuke Hashibira, Shinobu Kocho, and Giyu Tomioka
Bonuses for Sweep the Board! save data:
1 Character Unlock Key – Hinatsuru, Makio, and Suma
All three serve as one playable character
3 Battle Attire Costumes – Hinatsuru (Meal Prep), Makio (Meal Prep), and Suma (Meal Prep)
Please note the respective save data must be linked through the same platform users purchase The Hinokami Chronicles 2.

Demon Slayer -Kimetsu no Yaiba- The Hinokami Chronicles 2 is scheduled to be released in North America and Europe on August 5, 2025, for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, Steam, and the Nintendo Switch family of systems.

item.title: Something for the Weekend – 01/03/25
item.content:encoded:
https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/03/01/something-for-the-weekend-01-03-25/

I’ve never quite been clear when you’re allowed to break out the ol’ “pinch, punch, first of the month”. The rules always seem to be quite inconsistent. Is it any 1st of the month, or is it only from October onwards? And do you have to stop by midday, like with April Fools?

Anyway, spring has officially sprung, meteorologically speaking, and even though it’s still distinctly chilly a lot of the time, I’m definitely feeling the seasons shift. But this past week has seen the last throes of winter game launches, and one of the biggest games of the year is upon us all.

In the News This Week

  • Warner Bros. shuts down Monolith, Player First Games & WB Games San Diego – Wonder Woman cancelled
  • Fable has been delayed to 2026, but Xbox share some tiny new gameplay clips
  • La Quimera is a new sci-fi shooter from the Metro developers and Nicolas Winding Refn
  • Metro developer 4A Games Ukraine rebrands as Reburn – Why, how, and does 4A Games still exist?
  • Frostpunk 2 is coming to consoles this summer
  • MercurySteam reveals Blades of Fire fantasy action RPG, and it’s coming out in May!
  • Esoteric Ebb to be published by Raw Fury, become a cleric in this CRPG
  • PSVR 2 gets a big permanent price cut
  • Terminator 2D: No Fate revealed – “The T2 game we should have had”
  • Capcom responds to Monster Hunter Wilds PC performance problems with basic troubleshooting
  • The March 2025 PS Plus monthly games are revealed, includes Dragon Age: The Veilguard

Games in Review & Featured Articles

This week was all about Monster Hunter Wilds… or was it? That game is a truly fantastic new entry in what has become one of the biggest game franchise going, but there’s also the great new Two Point Museum, if you’d rather curate bones than hunt the creatures that own them…

  • Monster Hunter Wilds – PS5, XSX|S, PC – 9/10
  • Two Point Museum – PS5, XSX|S, PC – 8/10
  • PGA Tour 2K25 – PS5, XSX|S, PC – 8/10
  • Tomb Raider IV-VI Remastered – PS5, XSX|S, PS4, XBO, NSW, PC – 5/10
  • Afterlove EP – PS5, XSX|S, NSW, PC – 5/10

We also had another controller review, with the very featureful and cost-effective Cyclone 2

  • GameSir Cyclone 2 – NSW, PC, iOS, Android – 9/10

And away from all of the review, Steam Next Fest presented an opportunity to check out some up and coming titles. Steve had his hands full with the Lovercraft-y Stygian: Outer Gods, the thoroughly odd mythology of Moroi, and sampled the Gothic 1 Remake. Meanwhile, Miguel descended into Hell to try and arrest Satan in Shotgun Cop Man.

Rounding out the week, What We Played featured Monster Hunter Wilds, Avowed and Two Point Museum.

Trailer Park

Pokémon Legends: Z-A brings real-time battles and Mega Evolutions – coming late 2025

Forza Horizon 5 PS5 release date set for April 29th – launching alongside Horizon Realms update

GORN 2 heralds a new generation of VR physics-based gladiatorial combat

Tron: Catalyst gets a June release date and a new trailer

Moonlighter 2: The Endless Vault new gameplay trailer confirms it’s day one for Game Pass

Your Achievements

What have you been playing this week? Well…

  • Andrewww completed Call of the Sea with his daughter, enjoying sovling the puzzles together. When the wee ones had gone to bed, he got stuck in with Resident Evil 3, though he’s sort of stuck just after the power station and keeps running into Nemesis….
  • And while TSBonyman patiently waits for Atomfall, he’s been putting more time into No Man’s Sky thanks to the Worlds 2 update.

That’s the round up for this week. Hope you have a great weekend ahead!

item.title: Sins of a Solar Empire 2’s Path to Power DLC will be available from March 27th
item.content:encoded:
https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/03/01/sins-of-a-solar-empire-2s-path-to-power-dlc-will-be-available-from-march-27th/

Stardock has announced that it will be releasing the first paid DLC for Sins of a Solar Empire 2 on March 27th, and that DLC is called Path to Power. This new content will add more than 10 new scenario maps for players to navigate, with new objectives to tackle from defending your territory to assimilating other races into your own empire.

“The ‘Paths to Power’ DLC lays the foundation for new, more dynamic styles of gameplay in the Sins’ universe,” said Brian Clair, Executive Producer at Stardock. “Not only will players get new experiences from this DLC, but modders will gain access to a whole new set of options to bring their creations to life.”

Three of the scenarios are ‘All As One’, ‘Defend the Homeworld, and ‘Scorched Space.’ In the ‘All As One’ scenario players take control of the Vasari Alliance which is facing a catastrophic event with planets disintegrating as an unknown force moves through the darkness. The objective is to escape but to do that the Vasari Alliance will need to gather resources and forge new relationships with other factions to help them. In ‘Defend the Homeworld’, players play as Pranast United which is under attack. There is no victory condition, as victory is impossible. The only goal is to see how long you can survive the waves of attack. In the ‘Scorched Space’ scenario, a new star system has been found that contains the remnants of an unknown race. There are two options in this scenario. Restore this lost technology for your own use, or destroy it to keep it out of the hands of other factions.

The paid content is not all that will be coming to Sins of a Solar Empire 2. Update 1.4 will change the relationship between population and culture, with a larger population making your empire more influential in the grand scheme of the game. There will be new units added as well and some balance changes too. Paths of Power has been priced at $12.99, but is also part of the Content Pass and the Premium edition at no additional cost.

Source: Press Release
